meanings.definition: To sell at a lower price than a competitor.
meanings.sent1: The store outprices its rivals to attract more customers.
meanings.sent2: She always outprices the other sellers at the market.
meanings.sent3: The clever shopper outprices everyone by finding the best deals.
meanings.sent4: In the battle of prices, he consistently outprices his opponents.
meanings.sent5: Outpricing the competition is key to dominating the market.

meanings.definition: To offer a lower price than someone else.
meanings.sent1: I will outprice my friend to win the bidding war.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to outprice their competitors to gain more customers.
meanings.sent3: The student tried to outprice his classmates in the charity auction.
meanings.sent4: She managed to outprice her rival by a significant margin.
meanings.sent5: Outpricing others requires strategic planning and good timing.

meanings.definition: To set a price lower than others.
meanings.sent1: The new restaurant outprices its menu to attract more diners.
meanings.sent2: They always outprice their products to stay ahead in the market.
meanings.sent3: The farmer decided to outprice his produce to sell it quickly.
meanings.sent4: The company outprices its services to appeal to budget-conscious customers.
meanings.sent5: Outpricing the competition can lead to increased sales and brand loyalty.
